articles.title: create content
articles.description: How to create blog posts and articles for your site
articles.contents:
To create a new post, use the create_post() function. In the console, type…

create_post("whatever you want the title to be")

This function will open a new folder within the _posts folder and a new .Rmd template for you to write in. You should edit the authors (it will default to those used last), write a description for your post, and add your text. To add a picture, save it into the img folder and insert a chunk with the following code inside.

knitr::include_graphics(here::here("img", "whatever.png"))

articles.title: customise
articles.description: Some tips for customising your distill site
articles.contents:
You can customise the look and feel of your distill site pretty easily. See some examples of other sites made with distill here.
1. Change the name of your site
In the top left corner, your site is currently called “internship blog”. You might want to change that to the name of your group. Open the _site.yml file and update the title.
You can also change the welcome message. Open the index.Rmd file and change the title.
2. Change the theme
You can change the fonts and colour scheme by choosing a theme. I’ve imported several examples from other distill sites. Choose your favourite theme from the list below.
piping.css
https://www.pipinghotdata.com/
sleep.css
https://milesmcbain.xyz/
models.css
https://www.tidymodels.org/
mock.css
https://themockup.blog/
tidy.css
https://www.tidymodels.org/
ijemaka.css
https://ijeamaka-anyene.netlify.app
To apply the theme, open your _site.yml and insert the name of the theme where it says theme:

articles.title: How to...
articles.description: Some "how to" details about working with distill/RMarkdown
articles.contents:
This blog is created using a package called distill. It is an R-Markdown based platform specifically designed for science communication. The package website is a useful source of information about how to set up and maintain a distill site. You can see examples of other sites that have been created using distill here.
Here are some tips for …
working in RMarkdown
customising your site
creating new content

articles.title: Hey there!
articles.contents:
About us
Include a profile picture by taking a selfie of your team and replacing the avatar.jpg file with your own.
Insert a short paragraph here about each of the members of your group.
Billie Eilish
My favourite food on campus is Guzmen & Gomez. I get to UNSW on the bus/train. When we are allowed to travel again, the first place I am going to go is Bali.
Taylor Swift
My favourite food on campus is Stockmarket. To get to campus, I ride my bike. When we are allowed to travel again, the first place I am going to go is Thailand.
Lady Gaga
My favourite food on campus is Subway. I drive my car to get to UNSW campus. When we are allowed to travel again, the first place I am going to go is New Zealand.

articles.title: Rmarkdown
articles.contents:
Writing in RMarkdown is different to writing in Word. What you see is not quite what you get.
If you want italics use one asterisk. For bold, use two asterisks. You can get levels of heading with hash.
BIG HEADING
SMALLER HEADING
EVEN SMALLER HEADING
You can get bullet points using dash…
first important point
second point
and third…
You can include code “chunks” by using the shortcut, option-command I or choosing Insert R from the top menu bar.
Code chunks are useful for including code for plots with your text and also useful for inserting pictures
Save your image file in the img folder and tell R where to find it using the include_graphics() function


knitr::include_graphics(here::here("img", "band.jpg"))








The [RMarkdown reference guide](https://rstudio.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/rmarkdown-reference.pdf?_ga=2.15167350.1148129883.1606704012-1288179797.1570929100) is helpful in learning how to create formatted text in R-Markdown. To preview what your formatted text will look like, use the "Knit" button on the top bar, or the keyboard shortcut *Shift-Command-K*. 




```{.r .distill-force-highlighting-css}
